src_text: Presidential Summit on Gender-Based Violence and Femicide (GBVF)
trg_text: Presidential Summit on Gender-Based Violence and Femicide (GBVF)

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the hosting of the second Presidential Summit on GBVF at the Gallagher Estate in Midrand, Gauteng on 1 and 2 November 2022 under the theme:
trg_text: Cabinet welcomed the hosting of the second Presidential Summit on GBVF at the Gallagher Estate in Midrand, Gauteng on 1 and 2 November 2022 under the theme:

src_text: Accountability, Acceleration and Amplification, NOW!
trg_text: Accountability, Acceleration and Amplification, NOW!

src_text: The summit reflected on progress made in the implementation of declarations proposed during the 2018 Presidential Summit, which reaffirmed the country s commitment to a united, comprehensive and effective response to GBV
trg_text: The summit reflected on progress made in the implementation of declarations proposed during the 2018 Presidential Summit, which reaffirmed the country s commitment to a united, comprehensive and effective response to GBV

src_text: Participants at the two-day summit accounted for work being done towards the implementation of the National Strategic Plan (NSP) on GBVF, which aims to provide a multi-sectoral, coherent strategic policy and programming framework to strengthen a coordinated national response to the crisis of GBVF by the government and country as a whol
trg_text: Participants at the two-day summit accounted for work being done towards the implementation of the National Strategic Plan (NSP) on GBVF, which aims to provide a multi-sectoral, coherent strategic policy and programming framework to strengthen a coordinated national response to the crisis of GBVF by the government and country as a whol

src_text: The summit was the ideal platform to engage in honest and robust discussions around successes and challenges in the fight against GBV It also showcased the need for collective action and how significant success can be achieved if adequate resources are provided and managed correctl
trg_text: The summit was the ideal platform to engage in honest and robust discussions around successes and challenges in the fight against GBV It also showcased the need for collective action and how significant success can be achieved if adequate resources are provided and managed correctl

src_text: The agreements reached at the summit have demonstrated the importance of the partnership that government has forged with civil society, business, development partners, the faith-based sector and other sectors to work together to deal with the scourge of GBV
trg_text: The agreements reached at the summit have demonstrated the importance of the partnership that government has forged with civil society, business, development partners, the faith-based sector and other sectors to work together to deal with the scourge of GBV

src_text: Some of the interventions agreed upon included the need to allocate adequate funding to the NSP on GBVF, to implement consequence management mechanisms to ensure accountability, and to strengthen national, provincial and local accountability structure
trg_text: Some of the interventions agreed upon included the need to allocate adequate funding to the NSP on GBVF, to implement consequence management mechanisms to ensure accountability, and to strengthen national, provincial and local accountability structure

src_text: Cabinet reiterated that all acts of violence and abuse will not be tolerated in our societ Communities are urged to tackle the scourge of GBVF head-on by reporting perpetrators to law-enforcement agencie Each sector of our society must play its part by creating conditions that make it difficult, if not impossible, for GBVF to thrive
trg_text: Cabinet reiterated that all acts of violence and abuse will not be tolerated in our societ Communities are urged to tackle the scourge of GBVF head-on by reporting perpetrators to law-enforcement agencie Each sector of our society must play its part by creating conditions that make it difficult, if not impossible, for GBVF to thrive

src_text: Cabinet has reassured the public that the National Joint Operational and Intelligence Structure (NATJOINTS)
trg_text: Cabinet has reassured the public that the National Joint Operational and Intelligence Structure (NATJOINTS)

src_text: which comprises various government departments led by the State Security Agency, South African Police Service and South African National Defence Force
trg_text: which comprises various government departments led by the State Security Agency, South African Police Service and South African National Defence Force

src_text: has an intelligence-driven capacity to deal with threats to our national security, including terroris
trg_text: has an intelligence-driven capacity to deal with threats to our national security, including terroris

src_text: Through NATJOINTS, the security of the country is assessed regularly for any possible security threa As part of the cooperation agreements with other intelligence agencies from other countries, South Africa also benefits from the exchange of relevant intelligence information that can ensure the safety of the natio
trg_text: Through NATJOINTS, the security of the country is assessed regularly for any possible security threa As part of the cooperation agreements with other intelligence agencies from other countries, South Africa also benefits from the exchange of relevant intelligence information that can ensure the safety of the natio

src_text: Cabinet calls on the public to remain vigilant and to report any suspicious and illegal activities to law enforcement agencie Do not keep quiet; if you see something, say something
trg_text: Cabinet calls on the public to remain vigilant and to report any suspicious and illegal activities to law enforcement agencie Do not keep quiet; if you see something, say something

src_text: together we can keep the nation safe
trg_text: together we can keep the nation safe

src_text: 2022 Medium-Term Budget Policy Statement (MTBPS)
trg_text: 2022 Medium-Term Budget Policy Statement (MTBPS)

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the bold measures introduced in the 2022 MTBPS to restore the health of our public finances, just as the world economy is taking a dangerous turn for the wors
trg_text: Cabinet welcomed the bold measures introduced in the 2022 MTBPS to restore the health of our public finances, just as the world economy is taking a dangerous turn for the wors

src_text: The steps announced by Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana in Parliament, Cape Town on Wednesday, 26 October 2022, included narrowing our budget deficit greatly to improve our fiscal framework, support our economic standing and give South Africans every confidence in the future prospects of our econom The planned increase in contingency reserves allows us to deal with emergencies such as natural disaster The 2022 MTBPS further boosts our key priorities of infrastructure and service-delivery programmes, and provides additional relief to support the poor and vulnerable in our natio
trg_text: The steps announced by Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana in Parliament, Cape Town on Wednesday, 26 October 2022, included narrowing our budget deficit greatly to improve our fiscal framework, support our economic standing and give South Africans every confidence in the future prospects of our econom The planned increase in contingency reserves allows us to deal with emergencies such as natural disaster The 2022 MTBPS further boosts our key priorities of infrastructure and service-delivery programmes, and provides additional relief to support the poor and vulnerable in our natio

src_text: Cabinet calls on all socio-economic sectors to partner with the government to uplift our economy to improve the lives of our citizens across the country
trg_text: Cabinet calls on all socio-economic sectors to partner with the government to uplift our economy to improve the lives of our citizens across the country

src_text: Spain relations

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the outcome of the Official Visit to South Africa by Prime Minister Pedro S nchez P rez-Castej n of Spain to solidify the already strong relations between the two countrie The Prime Minister was accompanied by the Spanish Minister for Industry, Trade and Tourism, Ms Reyes Maroto, and a business delegatio
trg_text: Cabinet welcomed the outcome of the Official Visit to South Africa by Prime Minister Pedro S nchez P rez-Castej n of Spain to solidify the already strong relations between the two countrie The Prime Minister was accompanied by the Spanish Minister for Industry, Trade and Tourism, Ms Reyes Maroto, and a business delegatio

src_text: The visit created opportunities for various South African sectors to meet with their Spanish counterparts and to deepen cooperation in trade and investment, science and innovation, arts and culture, sports and educatio
trg_text: The visit created opportunities for various South African sectors to meet with their Spanish counterparts and to deepen cooperation in trade and investment, science and innovation, arts and culture, sports and educatio

src_text: This visit provided another boost to the country s investment and economic growth drive
trg_text: This visit provided another boost to the country s investment and economic growth drive

src_text: Ethiopia
trg_text: Ethiopia

src_text: Tigray Peace Talks South Africa, under the auspices of the African Union, hosted formal peace talks between the warring sides in the conflict in Ethiopia's Tigray region, from 25 to 30 October 2022.
trg_text: Tigray Peace Talks South Africa, under the auspices of the African Union, hosted formal peace talks between the warring sides in the conflict in Ethiopia's Tigray region, from 25 to 30 October 2022.

src_text: The dialogue was facilitated by Nigeria s former President Olusegun Obasanjo, Kenya's former President Uhuru Kenyatta and South Africa's former Deputy President Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuk Cabinet expressed its support for a peaceful and sustainable solution to the conflict, in line with South Africa s foreign policy objectives of a secure and conflict-free continen
trg_text: The dialogue was facilitated by Nigeria s former President Olusegun Obasanjo, Kenya's former President Uhuru Kenyatta and South Africa's former Deputy President Phumzile Mlambo-Ngcuk Cabinet expressed its support for a peaceful and sustainable solution to the conflict, in line with South Africa s foreign policy objectives of a secure and conflict-free continen

src_text: National Integrated Small Enterprise Development (NISED) Strategic Framework
trg_text: National Integrated Small Enterprise Development (NISED) Strategic Framework

src_text: Cabinet approved the NISED Strategic Framework for implementatio The initial Integrated Strategy for the Promotion of Entrepreneurship and Small Enterprises (ISPESE) was adopted in 2005.
trg_text: Cabinet approved the NISED Strategic Framework for implementatio The initial Integrated Strategy for the Promotion of Entrepreneurship and Small Enterprises (ISPESE) was adopted in 2005.

src_text: The ISPESE and the subsequent NISED give effect to the 1995 White Paper on the National Strategy for the Development and Promotion of Small Business in South Afric
trg_text: The ISPESE and the subsequent NISED give effect to the 1995 White Paper on the National Strategy for the Development and Promotion of Small Business in South Afric

src_text: The NISED Strategic Framework provides an integrated strategy to strengthen and support entrepreneurship for small and medium-sized enterprise It provides a structured coordination framework for all key ecosystem role players in small to medium enterprise developmen
trg_text: The NISED Strategic Framework provides an integrated strategy to strengthen and support entrepreneurship for small and medium-sized enterprise It provides a structured coordination framework for all key ecosystem role players in small to medium enterprise developmen

src_text: In April this year, Cabinet approved the publication of the draft NISED strategic framework for public commen Through the wide consultations, the strategy was enhanced by inputs from the public and from the National Economic Development and Labour Council, which is a forum comprising business, civil society, labour, academics and government that seeks to deal with economic, labour and development issues and related challenges facing the country
trg_text: In April this year, Cabinet approved the publication of the draft NISED strategic framework for public commen Through the wide consultations, the strategy was enhanced by inputs from the public and from the National Economic Development and Labour Council, which is a forum comprising business, civil society, labour, academics and government that seeks to deal with economic, labour and development issues and related challenges facing the country

src_text: Draft Policy on Social Development Services to Persons with Disabilities Cabinet approved the publishing for public comment of the draft Policy on Social Development Services to Persons with Disabilitie The policy gives effect to the White Paper on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities and the United Nations (UN) Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (UNCPRD).
trg_text: Draft Policy on Social Development Services to Persons with Disabilities Cabinet approved the publishing for public comment of the draft Policy on Social Development Services to Persons with Disabilitie The policy gives effect to the White Paper on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities and the United Nations (UN) Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (UNCPRD).

src_text: The policy guides the Department of Social Development in the provision of its services to persons with disabilities and their respective familie
trg_text: The policy guides the Department of Social Development in the provision of its services to persons with disabilities and their respective familie

src_text: It outlines the restrictive environment and barriers that continue to marginalise and exclude persons with disabilities from mainstream society, and from participating in social and economic activitie It proposes monitoring mechanisms that will ensure closer tracking of its implementation and mainstream interventions within the relevant department
trg_text: It outlines the restrictive environment and barriers that continue to marginalise and exclude persons with disabilities from mainstream society, and from participating in social and economic activitie It proposes monitoring mechanisms that will ensure closer tracking of its implementation and mainstream interventions within the relevant department

src_text: South Africa is a signatory to the UNCPRD and the African Charter on Human and People s Rights on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities in Afric 3.
trg_text: South Africa is a signatory to the UNCPRD and the African Charter on Human and People s Rights on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities in Afric 3.

trg_text: The IPCC

src_text: Cabinet approved the concept and the theme for the 2022 DRAM and National Day of Persons with Disabilities, which runs from 3 November to 3 Decembe The theme is:
trg_text: Cabinet approved the concept and the theme for the 2022 DRAM and National Day of Persons with Disabilities, which runs from 3 November to 3 Decembe The theme is:

src_text: Empowering Persons with Disabilities through resourceful, sustainable and safe environments .
trg_text: Empowering Persons with Disabilities through resourceful, sustainable and safe environments .

src_text: The theme emphasises the importance of resolving existing barriers affecting people with disabilitie This includes ensuring resourceful, sustainable and safe environments for persons with disabilities, and also recognising that not all disabilities are visibl
trg_text: The theme emphasises the importance of resolving existing barriers affecting people with disabilitie This includes ensuring resourceful, sustainable and safe environments for persons with disabilities, and also recognising that not all disabilities are visibl

src_text: The month-long activities will raise awareness and also showcase the progress the country has made in ensuring the protection of the rights of persons with disabilities, as enshrined in the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of 1996.
trg_text: The month-long activities will raise awareness and also showcase the progress the country has made in ensuring the protection of the rights of persons with disabilities, as enshrined in the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of 1996.
